alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Ventura County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 27 at 4:00AM PST until March 01 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, moderate snow with snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations will range from 2 to 6 inches between 3000 and 5000 feet to 6 to 12 inches with local amounts to 16 inches above 5000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Ventura County Mountains and Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 PM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible due to reduced visibility due to snow and blowing snow. Mountain roads, including Highway 33 and Lockwood Valley Road will likely be impacted at times. Snow drifts, especially above 5000 feet may be another substantial travel hazard. The weight of recent snow combined with strong winds may down trees and powerlines. The worst impacts are expected late Tuesday into Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels initially between 3500 to 4500 feet may drop as low as 2000 feet late Wednesday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions from CalTrans are available by calling 1 800 4 2 7 7 6 2 3.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Interior Mountains; Ventura County Mountains
